result.execSummary:
The defendant Chance Lee Clauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

10:30 AM w/ Case 22CF17; Defendant Chance Lee Clauer in court, in custody.  Attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Chance Lee Clauer. Victim Rights compliant; Court reviews charges and penalties. Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to Counts 1 & 2 in case 21CF252 and NO CONTEST to Count 1 in 22CF17. Court completes PQWOR with Defendant. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant GUILTY and STRIKES the Repeater Enhancer from each count. State reviews facts and criminal history and makes sentencing recommendation. Attorney Klein makes statement and sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court sentences Defendant to:

21CF252
Count 1-Assault by Prisoner
15 months Initial Confinement
1 year Extended Superivision

Count 2-Assault by Prisoner
15 months Initial Confinement
1 year Extended Supervision
**CONCURRENT to each other, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence


22CF17
Count 1-Assault by Prisoner
15 months Initial Confinement
1 year Extended Supervision
**CONSECUTIVE to 21CF252 and any other Conviction

***191 days Pre-Sentence Credit on Case 21CF252
***NO Restitution Request

DNA Sample
NO Voting/NO Firearms
NOT eligible for programming

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:49 PM Defendant Chance Lee Clauer in court, in custody with attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde. Eligible for SPD;  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Chance Lee Clauer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $2000.00 CASH bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
